title: Practical Management of Digital Learning Content and Instructional Design Processes

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic digital learning tools and understanding of foundational instructional design theories
context.additional_context: Support for real-time collaborative learning environments using personal devices (BYOD) for corporate language education managers or content developers.

learning_goals: The digital content design process based on learning scenarios can be explained by dividing it into three or more stages.
Documentation of personalized learning path designs reflecting learner profiling.
Implementation of content packaging utilizing metadata based on IEEE/ADL standards.
Analysis of case studies applying Didactic Structure in the design of web-based interactive activities.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
